Le Mont Celeste

Located in the west of Canada on the Vancouver island, Dörtstan demarcates its borders over an area of 14.5 km² around the famous Mount Celeste which peaks at 2045 m and its four lakes.

Our borders extend north to the shore of the smallest of the four lakes, the lake. The route then follows the western side of the mountain until it surrounds Lake Milla. To the south outside our borders are Mounts Harmston and Arthur Evans and Lake Mirren to the east. To the east and a little further north in our border there is also our largest lake with an area of 1.15 km² which is called Memory Lake. In the center is Mount Celeste located in the heart of Strathcona Provincial Park and is the tenth highest peak on Vancouver Island.
